intro: Elleanthus wercklei, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, leathery pods that contain seeds with a distinctive, waxy coating. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
